item.title: Not Everyone likes Pilgrimages
item.description: As the RTHL team goes through catalogues in search of Latin works about the Holy Land written during the crusades, one comes often across interesting things. One of the most popular literary genres of this corpus during the crusader period were pilgrimage guides. They were often written by eye-witnesses who, however, often reused material from other sources and accounts of other pilgrims. One such account is found in a thirteenth-century manuscript preserved at the British Library in London (MS Harley 2333).
